desc: Not configured

name: Static image
desc: Shows a static image, from file system or painter. Make sure to resize the image to the correct resolution.

param.name: Filename
param.desc: Local filename on the littlefs drive

param.name: Dithering
param.desc: Turn halftone dithering on or off. Turn it on when displaying photos. For texts, you better leave if off

name: External image
desc: Image from external source

name: Home Assistant
desc: Image from Home Assistant

name: Current date
desc: Shows the current date

desc: Counts days, starting with the value below. If the count value gets higher than the threshold, the number is displayed in red, otherwise it's black

param.name: Counter value

param.name: Threshold
param.desc: Value is displayed in red if higher than the threshold

name: Count hours
desc: Counts hours, starting with the value below. If the count value gets higher than the threshold, the number is displayed in red, otherwise it's black

param.name: Counter
param.desc: Current value

param.name: Threshold
param.desc: Value is displayed in red if higher than the threshold

name: Current weather
desc: Current weather. Weather data by Open-Meteo.com. Parameters Lat, Lon and Time Zone are filled automatically from the entered location. In case of an ambiguous location, choose from the drop down list.

param.name: Location
param.desc: Name of the city. This is used to lookup the lat/long data, and to display as the title

param.name: Units
param.desc: Celcius or Fahrenheit?

param.name: Lat
param.desc: Latitude (set automatic when generating image)

param.name: Lon
param.desc: Longitude (set automatic when generating image)

param.name: Time zone
param.desc: Time zone (set automatic when generating image)

name: Weather forecast
desc: Weather forecast for the next five days. Weather data by Open-Meteo.com. Parameters Lat, Lon and Time Zone are filled automatically from the entered location. In case of an ambiguous location, you can alter those manually.

param.name: Location
param.desc: Name of the city. This is used to lookup the lat/long data, and to display as the title

param.name: Units
param.desc: Celcius or Fahrenheit?

param.name: Interval
param.desc: How often the forecast is being refreshed.

param.name: Lat
param.desc: Latitude (set automatic when generating image)

param.name: Lon
param.desc: Longitude (set automatic when generating image)

param.name: Time zone
param.desc: Time zone (set automatic when generating image)

desc: Dutch rain predictions for the next two hours. Only works for locations in the Netherlands and Belgium.

param.desc: Name of the city. This is used to lookup the lat/long data, and to display as the title

param.name: Lat
param.desc: Latitude (set automatic when generating image)

param.name: Lon
param.desc: Longitude (set automatic when generating image)

name: RSS feed
desc: Gets an RSS feed, and display the first few lines of it

param.name: Title
param.desc: Displayed title

param.name: URL
param.desc: Full URL of the RSS feed

param.name: Interval
param.desc: How often (in minutes) the feed is being refreshed. Negative value to align the interval (-60 is 'on the whole hour')

name: Image URL
desc: Gets an external image and displays it

param.name: URL
param.desc: Full URL of the image. Image should be in jpeg format (non-progressive), and with exactly the right resolution for the screen (eg 128x296 or 152x152). Will be auto-rotated. Colors will be dithered

param.name: Interval
param.desc: How often (in minutes) the image is being fetched. Minimum is 3 minutes. Negative value to align the interval (-60 is 'on the whole hour')

name: QR code
desc: Displayes a full screen QR code

param.name: Title
param.desc: Displayed title

param.name: QR content
param.desc: Any content that can be coded into a QR code

name: Google calendar
desc: Displays the current and upcoming appointments (next 24 hours) from a Google calendar. To let this work, you need a small Google Apps Script to interface with your calendar. See documentation on github how to do that

param.name: Title
param.desc: Displayed title

param.name: Apps Script URL
param.desc: URL given by Google Apps Script

param.name: Interval
param.desc: How often (in minutes) the calendar is being refreshed. Negative value to align the interval (-60 is 'on the whole hour')

name: Time Stamp
desc: Displays the last date and time when a button press took place. For example, to keep track of the last time somebody let the dog out, or when you last watered the plants, or change the bed sheets.

param.name: Title
param.desc: Displayed title

param.name: Name for Button 1
param.desc: Text displayed for button 1 (for example, a name or activity)

param.name: Name for Button 2
param.desc: Text displayed for button 2 (for example, a name or activity)

param.name: Working mode
param.desc: With 'keep one time', both buttons reset the same timestamp, recording which button is pressed last. The option for seperate date/time, records two different timestamps, one for each button.

param.name: Frequency (days)
param.desc: When is the next action expected to take place (in days after a timestamp). Leave 0 to disable.

param.name: Timestamp 1
param.desc: The date/time the last event took place

param.name: Name, or timestamp 2
param.desc: The name of the button that was pressed, or in case of seperate timestamp, the date/time of the second button press

name: Dayahead prices
desc: Dayahead dynamic electricity tariffs. Source: transparency.entsoe.eu

param.name: Country
param.desc: Select your country. If your country is not in the list, we couldn't find the right region for it on transparency.entsoe.eu . Add an issue on the OEPL github to add it

param.name: Fixed surcharge
param.desc: Fixed surcharge per kWh, in 1/100 units (cents/öre/øre)

param.name: Tax percentage
param.desc: Percentage to add to the total (for example, 21, for 21% VAT)

param.name: Price units
param.desc: Display whole units (EUR/NOK/DKK) or cents

name: Json template
desc: Gets an external json template and displays it

param.name: URL
param.desc: Full URL of the json template. See OpenEpaperLink wiki for the right json format. Specify a url OR a filename

param.name: Filename
param.desc: Filename of the json template. See OpenEpaperLink wiki for the right json format. Specify a url OR a filename

param.name: Interval
param.desc: In case of an url, how often (in minutes) the template is being fetched. Minimum is 3 minutes. Negative value to align the interval (-60 is 'on the whole hour')

name: Display a copy
desc: Mirror the contents of a source tag to this destination tag, regardless of the content. The two tags should be of the same type. Ideally, the destination tag is local to the AP.

param.name: Mac-address
param.desc: Mac-address of the tag you want to use as content source. The source tag should either be associated with this access point, or this access point should be the content source.

name: Access point info
desc: Displays information about the currently connected access point

name: Image preload
desc: Preloads an image to be shown at different situations. Make sure to resize the image to the correct resolution.

param.name: Filename
param.desc: Local filename on the littlefs drive

param.name: TimeToLive
param.desc: Amount (minutes) that this image will stay valid. The tag might not respond meanwhile

param.name: Dithering
param.desc: Turn halftone dithering on or off. Turn it on when displaying photos. For texts, you better leave if off

param.name: Display or Preload
param.desc: Display now or preload for later use

param.name: Preload LUT
param.desc: Triggered preload images will display with this LUT

param.name: Preload Image type
param.desc: Preload type to send to tag, for later recall, or special use

name: Remote content
desc: Content is generated by a different Access Point

name: Set segments
desc: Used for debugging. Work in progress

name: Set NFC URL
desc: Send the URL to the NFC chip. The URL is transmitted to a NFC reader (like your phone) if you hold it next to the tag

param.name: URL
param.desc: Full URL

name: Send custom LUT
desc: EXPERIMENTAL. Don't use. YOU RISK DAMAGING YOUR SCREEN.

param.name: bytes
param.desc: 76 bytes, formatted as 0x00,0x00,...

name: Send Command
desc: Send a command to a tag to execute; only to be used for tests during development

param.name: CMD id
param.desc: Action

name: Set Tag Config
desc: Sets tag options. The options you see below are the default options. This may or may not match current tag settings

param.name: Boot method
param.desc: How the tag should boot, fast or normal

param.name: RF Wake
param.desc: If the tag should support RF wake or not. This adds a 0.9µA current draw

param.name: Tag Roaming
param.desc: If enabled, the tag will periodically scan for AP's and will switch to a different channel if a stronger signal is found

param.name: Scan for AP on timeout
param.desc: If a tag hasn't found an AP for an hour, should it rescan the channels for another AP?

param.name: Low Battery symbol
param.desc: Should the tag display the 'low battery' symbol if the battery a voltage threshold has been reached?

param.name: No AP symbol
param.desc: Should the tag display the 'No-signal/AP' symbol if it hasn't been able to contact an AP?

param.name: Low voltage threshold
param.desc: Below what voltage should the tag display the 'low bat' symbol?

param.name: Fixed Channel
param.desc: What channel should the tag initially join?

name: Firmware update
desc: To update tag firmware. This is for developers only! Instead, please use the 'auto update' button (click the little triangle below) to auto download and flash the latest firmware. If you proceed in here anyway: make sure you send the right .bin file. You can brick your tag if you send a wrong file (in that case, you can only revive it using a tag flasher). There is NO protection against a wrongly uploaded file.

param.name: Filename
param.desc: Local file on littlefs partition
